intro: Navarretia intertexta subsp. intertexta, commonly known as the Sierra Valley bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This species is adapted to dry environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
